data.title: Great Food
data.text: Right in the middle of Decatur where the Transfer House formerly stood.  I have eaten Chinese food in Taiwan, Viet Nam, Japan, Guam, all over Hawaii, Seattle, San Francisco just to name a few.  The food here is on par with downtown Taipei, and anywhere else Chinese Cuisine is served..  Great!!

data.title: Just Okay for a Quick, Economical Lunch
data.text: Wednesday, 5 – August, 2015 I took my intern to lunch at the Chinese Tea Garden.  Neither of us had eaten there prior to this, so it was a first for both of us.  We arrived at approximately 1130 hours (11:30 am CDT).  The restaurant was void of patrons.  The hostess / waitress was very pleasant and told us to sit wherever we wanted.  Albeit this is an older property, the restaurant itself is in fairly good condition and was very clean.  The lunch menu offers standard Americanized Chinese staples in the inexpensive to modest price range, and each selection comes with egg drop soup, egg roll, and fried rice.  The food is of slightly less than average quality.  The portions are adequate.  The egg drop soup was decent, the egg roll sparse, and the fried rice was just okay.  I had the Chicken Lo Mein which to my surprise was made with Ramen noodles versus Lo Mein noodles.  My intern opted for the General Tao’s Chicken which he indicated was mediocre at best.  The Chinese Tea Garden is a mom and pop restaurant, just okay for a quick, economical lunch, provided that you don’t set your expectations too high.

data.title: Authentic Chinese food---run by a sweet little couple.
data.text: I have gone to Chinese Tea Garden for years.   It is quaint and not updated but their food is consistently wonderful.  The couple who run this restaurant have been there for as long as I remember.  I love their eggrolls and MooGoo Gaipan.  If you want fancy go somewhere else---if you want good Chinese food go here

data.title: family favorite
data.text: i have been going to the chinese tea garden since i was a little kid. love the food! love the price!

data.title: Stay away - this place is terrible
data.text: I visited this restaurant after a friend informed me it "wasn't bad."  The decor is very outdated and the restaurant has a lingering smell that I could not identify.  I ordered a vegetarian dish and was extremely disappointed.  This is the WORST Chinese food I have ever eaten.  The sauce was a starchy apparent flour based type that was very bland.  (For the record I ordered my food spicy.)  The vegetables were enveloped in this same sauce and were mushy.  I cannot recommend this restaurant - period...

data.title: Fresh food, healthy portions
data.text:
We are lifelong residents of Decatur and yet have never tried this place. We make every effort to patronize locally owned eateries, so we decided to come here. We will return. Fresh ingredients, cooked after you order, healthy portions!

Very vintage surroundings, but very clean. Good service. A small restaurant, but a real find!

data.title: Chinese at its best
data.text: If you're looking for an authentic chinese meal, look no further.  Probably the best egg-drop soup ever. And there lunch prices and the amount of food you get, can't be beat.
